title: [Large-scale] Digital Content Development for Educational Technology: Design Based on Information Processing Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of educational technology concepts and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Non-real-time online learning environment in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology setting. Learner roles: mid-level professionals (medical/legal/technical) with domain-specific language application.

learning_goals: Digital content storyboards can be designed by applying core principles of information processing theory
Content improvement plans incorporating expert validation (media/instructional design) and learner feedback (1:1 and small group) can be developed
A mobile-friendly digital content production process optimized for LMS platforms can be executed

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
